chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens
Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Lauren E Lemke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Apply 17 days sentence credit, if revoked.
Concurrent with: Count 2, if revoked.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  Court waives DNA sample and surcharge.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
Mental health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate by the agent.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Lauren E Lemke in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.

State moves to amend count 1 from a Felony to a Misdemeanor.
Amended Information filed.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to both counts 1 & 2.
Court finds the defenant Guilty of both counts 1 & 2.



Court orders the following:
Count 1: 
150 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
17 Days Credit - IF REVOKED.
Concurrent to:  Count 2.
STAYED.


Term of Probation: 9 Months.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended by the agent;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate by the agent.

Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives.  
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.






Count 2:
60 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
17 Days Credit - IF REVOKED.
Concurrent to:  Count 1.
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  9 Months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATIONS:
Same as count 1.

Costs:  $243
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
